page.title: 10FIELD STUDIES - HORTON KIRBY
page.content: The Kent Education Committee Field Centre in School Lane is used by schools in N. W. Kent. It takes children from 5 to 18 years old. The main building has 3 rooms. The adjoining school house can accommodate a small group. A full-time warden gives help and advice to teachers if required. Any school can book a visit. Many classes use the Centre as a base for a day's field work. Outside study can be followed up in the Centre, which is well stocked with field equipment, laboratory apparatus, books and local information. The adjoining field is planted with bushes to attract birds and insects. It has a pond, a bird hide and bee hives. There is an indoor observation hive. In the winter adult classes are held at the Centre.
